4.1.18  10:02 pm   Do you think Michael Jackson would still be highly revered if he didn't die?

     before he died, he had multiple guiness world records including Most Successful Entertainer of All Time, 24 Grammy Awards, 13 AMA awards (more than any other artist of all time), his Thriller album was the highest selling album of all time. He had won hundreds of awards (before dying), more than any other artist in the history of popular music. He shattered all kinds of records and was generally the most popular and successful entertainer/artist in the history of popular music. he reached legendary status well before the end of the 1980s and remained one of the most famous people on the entire planet, for the entire rest of his life. he touched some boys too but that's another story

     Like, do you have to die to be a lengend?

     no

html:
4.2.18  12:49 pm   Very often, I'll get ideas at the most random times,

     but I have a hard time just sitting down and trying to force a song out of thin air. I kind of have to have something, even if it's just a few bars, to work off of.

     Do you ever sit down and try to write a song from scratch.. as in, just sitting at the piano with nothing in mind (apart from the improv page, I guess)?

     Or do you usually wait for a melody idea or something to come to you (wherever and whenever that may be), and then start writing off of that idea?

html: 4.2.18  11:54 am   i made something and it sound really strong but it doesnt sound right because i suck at mixing and the correct way to approach this problem would be to get better at mixing but i want so much music to make and i actually want to listen my shit and trying and trying and trying different things with equalizers doesnt feel like making music but like polishing it, but also i am obsessed with my work to be mine so i cant just let someone else mix it for money etc. so all i can do is try one thing at a time by song and just have it without trying something else and try something else at the other song but that way i feel like the good stuff will come sooo much later then i expected and i want my things to sound good so H E L P M E

html:
4.2.18  10:45 am   ive been playing classical and jazz trumpet for years and it has always been the only thing that my family and people like that recognize me as. ive gotten the same book of sheet music for every gift giving holiday the past 3 years. Im realizing now that it really doesnt make me happy, it actually makes me really really stressed. I dont want to stop playing because there are some good people in the same program as me and it is the only thing that i do. I leave school at 5 everyday and have 3 rehearsals a day. i dont think im great with rhythms, no matter how easy they are i mess up. i dread going to rehearsal everyday and i dont know what to do. i thought this is what i wanted to do with my life but now i dont want to look at sheet music ever again, i feel trapped. i cant talk to my family about this

      and my friend doesnt care about music and doesnt understand, what would you do if you were in this situation?
original_html:

html: 4.2.18  9:48 am    i have all these fragmented ideas and i love them all im just trying to record them but its kinda hard sometimes. sometimes your imagination falls apart, sometimes its just hard to put them into words. and other times theyre so crazy that you wanna make them work but its difficult to be comfortable with your crazy ideas. its crazy and its a challenge but i feel like if i find a way to be comfortable with my ideas and do what i want with them, ill unlock something. im just trying to find a way to express them in the best form. does that make sense?
